definition.name: shim-auth-id
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLUABASE.idmresource.NOVLUABASEConnectionPrompts.gcv.dscr.shim-auth-id)Enter the distinguished name of the User Application Administrator. This is the user that will have rights to administer the User Application portal. Use the eDirectory format, i.e., cn=admin.ou=orgunit.o=novell, or browse to find the user.

definition.name: shim-auth-password
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLUABASE.idmresource.NOVLUABASEConnectionPrompts.gcv.dscr.shim-auth-password)Enter the password of the User Application Administrator specified above.

definition.name: Host
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLUABASE.idmresource.NOVLUABASEConnectionPrompts.gcv.dscr.Host)Enter the Host Name or IP address of the application server where the User Application is running. For example, 'http://ServerName' or 'https://123.456.78.99'.

definition.name: Port
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLUABASE.idmresource.NOVLUABASEConnectionPrompts.gcv.dscr.Port)Enter the Host port on the application server specified above. This is the port where the User Application is accessible e.g. 80, 8080, 8090. The default for Identity Manager 4 is 8180.

definition.name: ApplicationContext
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLUABASE.idmresource.NOVLUABASEConnectionPrompts.gcv.dscr.ApplicationContext)Enter the User Application Context. This is the context portion of the URL for the User Application WAR file. The default is: IDMProv.

definition.name: bOverrideinit
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLUABASE.idmresource.NOVLUABASEConnectionPrompts.gcv.dscr.bOverrideinit)Allow Override Initiator. Set to Yes to allow the provisioning administrator to start workflows in the name of the person for whom the provisioning administrator is designated as proxy.
